title: Overview
content: Cooking is one of the fastest skills to train in RuneScape 3. P2P players have access to Portable ranges, which give a 5% XP bonus and reduce burn chance significantly. The Cooking cape eliminates burn chance entirely for most fish once equipped.
The most efficient setup is using a Portable range placed next to a bank or bank chest, buying raw fish from the Grand Exchange, cooking in bulk, and dropping or banking the cooked product.

title: Levels 1-30: Basic Meats and Trout
content: At very low levels, cook basic meats to build up XP quickly. These are cheap and widely available.
- Levels 1-10: Raw beef or raw chicken (30 XP each) — kill cows or chickens nearby or buy from GE
- Levels 10-20: Trout (70 XP each) — buyable from the Grand Exchange cheaply
- Levels 20-30: Salmon (90 XP each) — a slight upgrade over trout

title: Levels 30-68: Salmon and Lobsters
content: Salmon and lobsters are the standard mid-level Cooking training fish. Both are cheap and widely available on the Grand Exchange.
- Levels 30-50: Salmon (90 XP each)
- Levels 50-68: Lobsters (120 XP each) — very common, low cost
Use a Portable range for a 5% XP bonus. A bank chest nearby (e.g., at the Cooking Guild) makes this highly efficient.

title: Levels 68-90: Monkfish and Sharks
content: From level 68 onwards, higher-tier fish provide better XP rates.
- Levels 68-80: Monkfish (150 XP each) — accessible P2P fish, moderate cost
- Levels 80-90: Sharks (210 XP each) — high XP per fish, widely available
With a Portable range and fast banking, expect 300,000–400,000 XP/hour at this stage.

title: Levels 90-99/120: Rocktails and Sailfish
content: Rocktails and Sailfish are the top-tier cooking targets. Sailfish provides the highest Cooking XP per action in the game.
- Levels 90-99: Rocktails (225 XP each) or Sailfish (270 XP each)
- Levels 99-120: Sailfish (270 XP each) — peak XP rate of 400,000–500,000 XP/hour with portables and all bonuses
The Cooking cape eliminates burn chance for all standard fish once worn, making burn-free cooking trivial.

title: Boosts and Tips
content: Several bonuses stack to greatly increase Cooking XP rates:
- Portable ranges: 5% XP bonus, reduced burn chance; obtain from Treasure Hunter or other players
- Cooking gauntlets: Drastically reduce burn rate for lobsters, swordfish, monkfish, sharks, rocktails, and sailfish
- Modified sous chef's outfit: Up to 6% bonus XP from the full set
- Pulse cores: 10% bonus XP for a limited time; very effective during high-rate cooking
- Double XP events: Greatly reduce the fish needed; stock up on raw fish before events
